How to Change Directories in Unix
19 Apr 2012
In Unix or any sort of Terminal interface the quickest way to navigate through folders is to use the cd command. You simply type cd 'folder_name' to "change directory" into the folder name. A simple shortcut to change into the directory one level up is to type in cd .. In Unix, one dot "." resembles the current directory, while two dots ".." signifies one directory up. To reiterate, if my folder structure was ~/folder/sample/structure/files and I was in the "sample" folder, to get to the folder called "folder" I would simply just type cd ... To get to the folder labeled "structure" I would type cd structure. It is that simple! Hope this hint helped you! Please post in the comments below with suggestions of future articles and questions, thank you!
